newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Chinese business delegation cancels Israel visit.
newsitem.headline: Chinese business delegation cancels Israel visit.

text.p: Deputy Chinese Prime Minister for Education and Trade Li Lanqing cancelled a visit to Israel planned for November at the head of a business delegation, an Israeli Foreign Affairs Ministry spokesman said on Thursday.

The spokesman denied a report in Israel's Haaretz newspaper the cancellation was politically motivated. The spokesman said the dates were inconvenient and the Chinese had expressed interest in rescheduling the visit.

The director of the international affairs department at the Federation of Israeli Chambers of Commerce, Ronnie Reiber, said a trade delegation from Poland recently cancelled a scheduled visit to Israel over the political situation.
Many foreign investors are taking a "wait-and-see" attitude towards Israel in light of heightened tension between Israelis and Palestinians and the stalled Middle East peace process.
But Reiber said the federation was "flooded" by delegations all the time: "Just last week we had two delegations from China with a third expected next week."
